title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
While spaghetti cooks, crisp pancetta/guanciale in a pan.
In a bowl, whisk eggs, Pecorino, and black pepper.
Drain spaghetti, reserving some pasta water. Add spaghetti to the pancetta pan.
Quickly pour egg mixture over hot pasta, stirring constantly. Add a splash of pasta water to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately, garnished with extra Pecorino and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, cumin, coriander, chili powder, and salt for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add chopped onion and cook until softened.
Add marinated chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Stir in crushed tomatoes and bring to a simmer. Cook for 15-20 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
Stir in heavy cream and simmer for another 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan.

title: Vegetable Stir-fry
summary: A quick and healthy dish packed with colorful vegetables and a savory sauce.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (broccoli, carrots, bell peppers, snap peas)
instructions: Prepare all vegetables.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil.
Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger; stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add harder vegetables (broccoli, carrots) and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add softer vegetables (bell peppers, snap peas) and stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
Pour in the sauce and toss to coat. Cook for 1 minute more until heated through.
Serve immediately with rice or noodles.

title: Classic Pancakes
summary: Fluffy, golden pancakes perfect for breakfast or brunch.
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined (lumps are okay).
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the griddle.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through.
Serve hot with your favorite toppings.
